protocol:
‚Ä¢ Temples: shoulders + knees covered; remove shoes, hats, and sunglasses before entering
‚Ä¢ Wai greeting: slight bow with hands together; not required for tourists but always appreciated
‚Ä¢ Royal family: never joke about monarchy (serious offense under Thai law)
‚Ä¢ Tipping: round up small bills; 20‚Äì50 THB extra for great service is enough
utility:
‚Ä¢ ATMs: use big-bank machines (Bangkok Bank, SCB, Krungsri); decline DCC to avoid bad FX rates
‚Ä¢ Cash vs card: keep small bills (20/50/100) for street food and taxis; cards fine in malls
‚Ä¢ 7‚ÄëEleven: first stop for SIM top‚Äëups, snacks, cold drinks, and basic medicine
‚Ä¢ Pharmacies: look for 'Boots' or local pharmacies on main roads; bring photos of medicine labels
dining:
‚Ä¢ Menus: point + smile; say 'mai phet' (not spicy) or 'phet nit noi' (a little spicy)
‚Ä¢ Paying: at street stalls, pay after eating; in restaurants, ask 'check bin, krap/ka' for the bill
‚Ä¢ Allergies: show written Thai card for serious allergies; confirm twice before ordering
‚Ä¢ Street food: choose busy stalls with fast turnover; prices posted = less chance of tourist markup

microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest BTS/MRT station (look for elevated or underground signs)
Use Google Maps (works well in Bangkok)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Grand Palace, Wat Pho, Chatuchak Market)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - Bangkok is navigable. Use BTS/MRT to avoid traffic.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Rabbit Card or use cash - BTS/MRT ‡∏ø16-59 per ride
BTS/MRT runs 6am-midnight, avoid rush hour 7-9am and 5-7pm
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis during rush hour. BTS/MRT is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Tuk-Tuk
actions: Taxis: meter required, negotiate if no meter
Tuk-tuks: negotiate BEFORE getting in (start at ‡∏ø50)
Boats are cheapest option for river areas
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use BTS/MRT for most trips. Negotiate tuk-tuks before getting in.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
actions: Avoid restaurants in Khao San Road (overpriced)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Street food is safe if busy.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
actions: Tipping: 10% if service good, ‡∏ø20-50 for taxis
Point at menu if language barrier
'Mai phet' = not spicy, 'Phet nit noi' = little spicy
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat where locals eat (busy = fresh). Street food is authentic and cheap.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. Thai food is accommodating but can be spicy.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: People-watch at a street food area
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. Bangkok is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Grand Palace (book online, visit 8:30am to avoid heat)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid midday heat (11am-3pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: Bangkok is generally safe, but trust your instincts
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Bangkok is generally safe, but stay alert in tourist areas (scams).

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
actions: Ignore: 'temple closed' touts (they'll take you shopping)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'Mai ao krap' (no thanks) and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - many Thais speak some English, but politeness matters.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. Pointing at menus is totally normal.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Thai people are very helpful. Use translation apps if needed.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Caf√© break (coffee ‡∏ø40-60, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Khao San Road
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real Bangkok is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR temples OR shopping
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Find a hidden street food stall
Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a street food area
Visit a local market and chat with vendors
Attend a local event (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If it's raining
actions: Caf√© culture: sit inside with a book
